com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers

Class ListWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers.AbstractWriter
      • com.googlecode.aluminumproject.writers.ListWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Writer

    public class ListWriter
extends AbstractWriter
    A writer that adds written objects to a list.

    The list that contains the written objects can be retrieved using the getList method. It only contains objects that are flushed. It's possible to configure a list writer to flush automatically by using the constructor that accepts a boolean. In that case, the writer is flushed after each write operation.

      • clear

        Specified by:

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws AluminumException
        Description copied from interface: Writer
        Flushes everything that has been written to this writer. If there's nothing to flush, nothing will happen. If this writer wraps another writer, the underlying writer will be flushed as well.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface Writer
        Overrides:
        flush in class AbstractWriter
        Throws:
        AluminumException - when this writer is closed or when something goes wrong while flushing
